question_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
question_list.text:
That damn call button jockey, room 9,
Is a pain in the base of my spine.
For no reason he rings
About minuscule things.
His sole purpose? To hear himself whine.
question_list.question: What is the sole purpose of the occupant of room 9?
alternate_answers: The sole purpose of the occupant of room 9 is to repeatedly press the call button, which can be quite frustrating for others.
The sole purpose of the occupant of room 9 is to ring the call button for no significant reason, mainly to hear himself whine.

question_list.author: MikeAq
question_list.text:
To compose a morose epicedium
Can brighten one's torpor and tedium.
I myself have an urge
To create a sad dirge —
One not overly mournful, just medium.
question_list.question: How can one brighten one's torpor and tedium?
alternate_answers:
The limerick suggests that composing a morose epicedium (a funeral song or poem) can help brighten one's torpor and tedium. The limerick states:

"To compose a morose epicedium 
Can brighten one's torpor and tedium.
I myself have an urge
To create a sad dirge —
One not overly mournful, just medium."

So the answer is that writing a moderately melancholy funeral poem or song can help alleviate boredom and listlessness, according to the limerick.

Compose a morose epicedium.
Craft a sad dirge, not too mournful,
Just medium, not scornful,
To lift your spirits, a musical medium.

question_list.author: Celia Warren
question_list.text:
Oh, don't throw your toys out your pram!
Yes, I treat all your emails as spam.
Hurt your feelings? Don't care;
I don't like you, so there!
Just accept that I don't give a damn!
question_list.question: Why do I treat all your emails as spam?
alternate_answers:
Because I don't like you, so there!
Your feelings? I don't really care.
Just accept that I'm cold,
And your messages, old,
Are as welcome as a grizzly bear.

question_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
question_list.text:
For me, this is clearly the right shift,
The boredom-slash-wild-drunken-fight shift.
It's been called D&D
("Death and donuts," you see).
Yes, there's nothing like working the night shift.
question_list.question: What is the nickname for the night shift in a store?

question_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
question_list.text:
Our most serious faces we don
As the blamestorming session goes on.
Someone died. Who's to blame?
The one person we name
Is a janitor's helper named Juan.
question_list.question: Who do they blame in the blamestorming session after someone dies?
alternate_answers:
Based on the limericks, it seems the person they blame in the blamestorming session after someone dies is often a scapegoat or someone undeserving of the blame. 

For example, one limerick mentions:

"Someone died. Who's to blame?
The one person we name
Is a janitor's helper named Juan."

This suggests that in the blamestorming session, they unfairly blame an innocent person, like the janitor's helper Juan, rather than finding the true cause of the death.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Blue Nude shows a woman of 30
Who's not all that terribly perty.
She looks sadly serene
And obscure, as if seen
Through a glass that's dark blue and real dirty.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
I caught that armadillo last fall:
C. truncatus, the smallest of all.
A pink Argentine fairy
I call "Pretty Mary,"
Unlike some, can't roll into a ball.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
De facto, this standard is one
That measures a thing once it's done.
Though it may be the worst,
It's the pattern — the first.
Isn't hindsight incredible fun?

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Just like that! went my one working ear.
Drops were needed; I barely could hear.
With no ear dropper found,
I kept looking around,
In great hopes that a sub would appear.

limerick_list.author: Jesse Frankovich
limerick_list.text:
The word abjugate means "to unlink,
Disconnect, or get things out of sync."
Long ago, people spoke it,
Connoting "unyoke it."
Today, it's outmoded, I think.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Jean says chaptalization is just
The addition of sugar to must.
Its use is berated
And hotly debated
Wherever fine wines are discussed.

limerick_list.author: Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
The blowup we had was a beaut;
She was mad (how'd I once think her cute?).
"If you can't be sincere,
I'll just blow out of here,
And don't argue—your points are all moot."

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
That his wife will, on purpose, subtract
From her outfit's tagged cost is a fact.
She works hard to perfect
What she's keen to protect:
A deceitful deliberate act.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail and Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
My girl's so aesthesiogenic
That all of my musculophrenic
Parts suffer sensations
In such concentrations
The outcome is too calisthenic.

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
I've been combing this trench for a year,
And found nary a good souvenir.
I continue to grope,
Now, I'm feeling some hope—
Found a sign saying, "Kilroy was here!"

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
In mid-state Indiana you'll find
BSU has the best things in mind
To help you meet your whole
Educational goal
If to excellence you are inclined.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
On the road from Bombay to New Delhi,
Wet clothes had been making me smelly.
With weather so spotty
I bought a bursati
That covers me shoulders to belly.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
See her ankling slow 'cross the floor?
There goes someone I'd pay to explore;
Guys like me can't be choosy.
But I'm sluggish and boozy—
Ain't budged yet. She's walked out the door.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Said a Mafia tough guy, Big Huey,
"I'm the kingpin for all of St. Louis.
Cut me in every day
As your 'partner,' let's say,
Or your face may end up like chop suey."

limerick_list.author: Andrew Burnet
limerick_list.text:
With his eye on the ultimate prize,
Andy Murray contestingly tries
To outdo Roger Federer,
Who only gets bederer
And triumphs (to no-one's surprise).

limerick_list.author: Jacqui Brown
Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text: Asked speller Iago LaMar, / "A·r·e  y·o·u  f·o·r / W·h·a·t  I / M·e·a·n  b·y / C·o·l·l·i·n·e·a·r?"

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
What's his next pitch? A fastball, no doubt,
And I'll muster a record-book clout—
But I swing much too soon
At his eephus balloon.
Then the ump says, "Strike three" and "You're out!"

limerick_list.author: Snowy Owl
limerick_list.text:
If word choices cause you frustration,
Be tricky and try affixation.
From store, get restore,
Storage, storing, and more —
Like substoral, my latest creation.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Disadvantage may cause people harm.
Cousin Margo has only one arm.
Though she hopes she can cope
When she skis down a slope,
Many bystanders gasp with alarm.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
My goat ranch has sure hit the skids.
Though my futures brought glittering bids,
My stock guarantee
Hit a goat STD —
An abortion storm cost me the kids.

limerick_list.author: Dottie
limerick_list.text:
Daft Danny O'Phee of Tralee
Would hang by his knee from a tree.
The reason for that
Was to act like a bat—
He was batty as batty could be!

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
Farmers markets are markets whereat
Local farmers sell produce and chat
About vegetables, meat,
Eggs, and fruit ripe and sweet
They've produced. Can't come fresher than that!

limerick_list.author: Jeff Foster
limerick_list.text:
A two-year-old toddled off sneakily
And started to fingerpaint … fecally.
Her Dad nearly fainted,
But asked what she'd painted.
"It's Da-Da!!" she volunteered cheekily.

limerick_list.author: Jacqui Brown
limerick_list.text:
Put three slices of toast in a stack.
Spread with mayo to make  a fine snack.
In between? Turkey, bacon,
Tomato. You're makin'
A club that'll bring 'em all back.

limerick_list.author: Jim Vincent
limerick_list.text:
From the jury—a perjury quiz
For Bill Clinton—here's why he's a whiz:
They were fallibly led
As he pretty much said,
It depends on the meaning of "is".

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
It has gotten annoying that my baby
Became a complainer—a crybaby.
Now this hard-hearted guy
Isn't asking her why—
He just heads for the door, waving "Bye, baby."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Docs in ASAM all treat the affliction
That's known to the world as addiction.
They'll help any youth
To tell falsehood from truth—
There are no harmless drugs; that's a fiction!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Citronellol: its smell is like roses.
Where it comes from, one hardly supposes,
Would be grass that supplies
Oil that drives away flies.
Citronella's not sweet to our noses.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
She's not the most gorgeous of chicks.
There's no way she's a 10.  She's a 6.
When I drink, though, she's hot
'Cause there's nothing she's got
That a half-dozen brewskies won't fix!

limerick_list.author: James Dobson
limerick_list.text:
The fording here's risky. Take note,
While you're wading across, of this quote:
"Have a care if the river
Comes up to your liver;
Turn back when your hat is afloat."

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
If a cutpurse should try to purloin
My collectible fourpenny coin,
Called a fuppence (or groat),
Then my personal vote
Is to kick his fat arse to Des Moines.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
We've been eager to party and drink,
But the tap on the keg's on the blink.
So it's soda, not beer—
Nothing's happening here.
Kinda sadder Budweiser, I think.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Our lab's gerontology crew
All came down with that new kind of flu,
But the old folks, protected,
Remained uninfected—
Vaccines we came up with came through.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
A poet I knew had a whim
To fpxymqfv line five of a lim,
He had little success —
Screwed up, made a mess;
Qyt fpxymqfvnfpa abhfpat efvf thyn!

limerick_list.author: Jim Vincent
limerick_list.text:
My neighbor's a "sharp-minded" gent.
He blunted my knife on cement.
He cut cardboard laid flat
On his driveway. That rat!
He's as dull as the blade that I lent.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
As a kicker, Nick Rose is the best.
Now he faces his ultimate test,
But a field goal, no doubt,
Starting 80 yards out
Is a challenge. It's good? I'm impressed!

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
Little John drew a line in the sand.
With bravado, he's taking a stand.
Just read his marquee:
"Don't emasculate me."
He will not let himself be dismanned.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
When stars have exhausted their fuel,
They'll explode, or just sit there and cool.
It takes billions of years,
But degenerate spheres,
The black dwarfs, cannot covet a joule.

limerick_list.author: DBRHoffman
limerick_list.text:
A cowboy named Lucky LaGrange
Was a failure out riding the range.
He stunk with a lasso,
And found old El Paso
Was addling, perplexing and strange.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
We're appalled at the polls, which have shown
We're electing a corpse! Might have known,
Since it's worthy of note
That our dead get to vote,
And perhaps he's just one of their own.

limerick_list.author: Bluebelle
limerick_list.text:
I love France and the French all the way:
Adore croissants, vin rouge, s'il vous plaît.
You may think I'm a true
Oxymoron. My view
Is I'm Francophile English—c'est vrai!

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
"Stir your drink, sir?" — but James Bond demurred.
"You should know that it's shaken, not stirred!
Though it sounds rather picky,
I once stirred a Mickey,
And woke up, my vision all blurred."

limerick_list.author: timon
limerick_list.text:
Our fishing was spoiled when the fog set
In heavy, and one of the dogs ate
What was left of our bait.
All we've caught there, to date,
Is blue perch, what the Indians call chogset.

limerick_list.author: proof and Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
A Washington hooker named Paula
Declared, "I'm on sale! You can ball a
Magnificent pro
For just ten bucks a throw!"
(Men were lined up from Walla to Walla.)

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Our conservative guv has new rules:
"We shall fund just for-profit  type schools.
Public schools cause high taxes —
To those takers take axes!"
Folks believe all his drivel, the fools.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
With bronchioles foul and dilated,
Bronchiectasis often is hated.
First you can't catch your breath,
Then you're coughing to death—
So it seems—till the cough has abated.

limerick_list.author: David Roberts
limerick_list.text:
A hasty young husband from Reading
Awoke to find crabs in the bedding.
Add the burn in his piss,
And his conjugal bliss
Gave way to regrets for the wedding.

limerick_list.author: Recumbentman
limerick_list.text:
Mr Bach, you may name your own price
If the music you write will suffice
To put boredom to flight
Through the long hours of night,
As an antineuritic device.

limerick_list.author: waterrocks
limerick_list.text:
Though the times were the worst and the best,
Sydney Carton's bleak life was not blessed
Till he knelt in the shade
Of the guillotine's blade
And prepared for his far better rest.

limerick_list.author: FlippingMackerel
limerick_list.text:
In a far land the king was despotical;
His purges were hot and zealotical.
And there wasn't a doubt
That the dead ones were "out-
Of-the-fire-and-into-the-pot-ical".

limerick_list.author: stella
limerick_list.text:
I'm skimming the waves in the bay,
With the wind in my hair and salt spray.
There's an easterly gale,
But homeward I sail,
With the centerboard holding the way.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
Why, you con-artist phony (political)!
You fudged your analysis (critical).
Your slick greedy ways'll
Corrupt your appraisal,
You son of a bitch (parasitical)!

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
It's a weasel that looks like a bear,
With gorgeous, thick, frost-shedding hair.
It's the glutton — I mean
The big mean wolverine.
Gulo gulo is gorging. Beware!

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
Bite your lip when I say I must fly.
Wish me luck as you wave me goodbye.
Watch till I'm out of sight—
It'll hit me tonight
That we're so far apart, and I'll cry.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I asked Mother to get a cornetfish
To improve the collection of pet fish
In my two large aquaria.
She replied: "Fistularia?
Much too long! Here's some cash, but forget fish!"

limerick_list.author: Buonarotti
limerick_list.text:
Seems the hero's not handsome or tall,
But the heroine sounds like a doll.
The script's called Anhedonia?
That title's baloney!  A
Much better name's Annie Hall!

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
It was brutal: their words should have hurt.
He hurled "birdbrain!" She countered "stuffed shirt!"
In a bitter exchange.
So their conduct seemed strange
When she slid his hand under her skirt.

limerick_list.author: danmcgrath
limerick_list.text:
Say a guy's telling stories and lies.
Disapprove? Show that sense with your eyes.
Sidelong looks at the lout
Shout suspicion and doubt.
Look askance — it says "lies are unwise."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I'll examine your neck—reconnoiter.
Wait! I've found it—that damned diving goiter!
Large thyroids will wander
Down low and up yonder,
Refusing to linger or loiter.

limerick_list.author: Bit
limerick_list.text:
I astonish; I cause apprehension.
My opinions inspire dissension.
I'm a caution who breeds
Shock and awe with my deeds;
But didn't I get your attention?

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Consider the lovely crown daisy.
You can eat it—I know that sounds crazy—
But in Chinese cuisine
It's the chop-suey-green.
Chuck some into your wok—don't be lazy.

limerick_list.author: Jeff Foster
limerick_list.text:
You can neither revise nor rehearse
Your Dadaist anti-art verse;
This gives the appearance
Of rank incoherence:
Conniption teen snot desert purse.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
A binomial sum, a plus b,
Can be raised to the power of c.
As the theorem affirms,
This will generate terms
Algebraic, of given degree.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Dashing Dan—he was never a masher;
For the railroad, an icon—a flasher.
Not the Dasher who sped
Pulling Santa's great sled,
He was just a commuter—a dasher.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
It's his birthday; I'll put out a feeler.
What would Pete like? He visits a dealer
Of large and small trucks.
I don't have lots of bucks—
Hope he falls for a modest four-wheeler.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Your insurer has doubts that you're curable,
As your wart looks enormous and durable.
It's unsightly and red,
And appears to have spread.
That's your head?  Very well; you're insurable.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
I call for my pipe and my bowl,
But my butler's a butthead and droll.
So he brings me a fife
(Not the joy of my life)
And a potty—he's out of control!

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
A rounder, a boozer, a bum,
Found a drug that was made from a gum.
Some churrus he chewed —
A reaction ensued —
He's passed out now and totally numb.

limerick_list.author: Duncan Stevens
limerick_list.text:
"Hey, Paddy, you're scoring your flesh!
Your iPod is playing John Tesh!
What's up with your brain?
Why cause yourself pain?"
"Don't want to—I'm under a geas."

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
On-site video there, though outmoded,
Was recording when Rover exploded.
It was your crud she swallowed,
Then the grisly stuff followed.
The tape's been cued up and it's loaded.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
For hunting this loud horn was born.
It was called by the Brits a "French horn".
Fixed-length-tube cors de chasse
Were a pain in the ass;
Did Brits blame that on somebody foreign?

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"I live just up the frog. My abode
Is right there," I advised. My ride slowed,
Since he knows rhyming slang
Like the rest of the gang.
(Frog and toad becomes frog = "road.")

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Both a hermit and genius unseen,
Thomas Chatterton's work kept him lean.
Thomas Rowley's instead
Was successful, which led
To his suicide, aged 17.

limerick_list.author: cilliantsu
limerick_list.text:
Some Cactaceae — family name
For the cactus — have led to my shame.
There they grew in the rut
Where I fell on my butt,
Which is now, like my face, all aflame.

limerick_list.author: Carl Lands
limerick_list.text:
Saul was blinded by light. Ananias
Told God, "Hey, I'm glad he can't eye us—
Saul is one holy terror."
Said God, "Just an error
Of judgment. Go cure him; he's pious."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The OEDILF is a rousing success,
And it does my heart good, I confess.
It's a joy through and through,
And a gladsomeness, too.
All in all, it's a great allegresse.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Bring diversity into our crew!
I want multiethnicity too!
I want folks of all races
From far-away places.
Does this guy look bluish to you?

limerick_list.author: Tom Strobel
limerick_list.text:
I think Janet Reno's erotic.
I'm afraid of becoming robotic.
To me you're all spies
Stealing thoughts through my eyes,
So I won't take your antipsychotic.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Someone rats on the coven—the hitch is,
The witches don't know who the snitch is.
If two hags falsely claim
That a third is to blame,
That's a covin in law. (Up yours, bitches!)

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
At a blood house sits Katie O'Grady.
She frequents the squalid and shady,
Like the bars, pubs, cafes,
And hotels where she stays.
And despite what you've heard, she's a lady.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I'm dismayed by my neighbors, the Babbitts,
Who raise cottontails, lovely brown rabbits.
They began with just two,
But the count quickly grew,
Due to rabbits' progenitive habits.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Best advice? I'd stay out of her way.
She debuts tonight: Boston Ballet.
Let her weep, rant and vent;
It's forbearance well spent.
She's consumed with excitement today.

limerick_list.author: Richard English
limerick_list.text:
Adapter — converting device.
It will fix up your kit in a trice!
It's a little-known quirk —
US gadgets won't work
In Europe, regardless of price.

limerick_list.author: Jeff Foster
limerick_list.text:
When your foot swings and gives it a jar,
A football can go mighty far.
Yet I've got to allow as
How yipping chihuahuas
I've drop-kicked are raising the bar.

limerick_list.author: waterrocks
limerick_list.text:
In Messina, the courts are aglow
With the news of the victory — so
Now the soldiers, returning,
Set everything churning:
All's hustle and bustle and show.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
He would mock those without a defense,
Like the poor.  (These were common events.)
Lots of cash I had paid
To a hitman by trade,
'Cause for cheap shots I spare no expense.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
My wife Jill loves your scrollwork, your filigree,
So daedal!  Big BUT:  I and Jill agree
Two thousand bucks
For a duck collar sucks,
Since it's rare to walk mallards, you will agree.

limerick_list.author: Ruchiccio
limerick_list.text:
"This fabric's to die for," she said.
"Just look at these deep shades of red.
I can tell you that my stuff
Is premium dyestuff.
Loathe red? Tint it purple instead."

limerick_list.author: hugh t.
limerick_list.text:
When I went on a Holy Land trip, I
Supposed there'd been some sort of slip; I
Said, "Banias? What's this?
Let's just give it a miss —
I want Caesarea Philippi!"

limerick_list.author: Mad Kane
limerick_list.text:
"It's so cute!" said the child, with delight.
"You can't have it," said Mom. "Puppies bite.
It's adorable, true,
But dogs nip, bark, and chew,
And your daddy will cower in fright."

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
"You can always, of course, change your mind.
If the one we supply you, you find
Doesn't suit, have a re-think,
And swap it." Makes me think,
My brain transplant team's too darn kind.

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
Do your building repairs burn through checks?
Does your town say "Condemned. Not to specs!"?
If it's really outmoded,
Then have it imploded.
Call a specialist: Edifice Wrecks.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
His clothes were atypically filled
By his overly muscular build,
But his sports-hero skill
Was derived from a pill—
Taking steroids, he nearly was killed.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
My grandma, who once was a dancer,
Was disabled by terminal cancer.
Now her tumor's removed
By a drug—unapproved—
Its compassionate use was the answer.

limerick_list.author: Basingstoke
limerick_list.text:
If with armament you're not equipped
For your soldiers (the guys you conscript),
If you haven't some rifles
Or similar trifles,
Your army will likely be whipped.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
My boyfriend's an addict who stole
And accused me of playing a role.
Now I'm named codefendant
But I'm not codependent—
I'll fight my way out of this hole.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
In describing the actor Clark Gable,
I  say fabulous. Thus I am able
To explain that he's grand
So you'll all understand.
(I don't mean that the guy's just a fable.)

limerick_list.author: Aliza
limerick_list.text:
As shellac it keeps woodwork so bright;
As a pie glaze it's airy and light.
Now Ms. Radner's floor shines,
While Dan "Acaroid" dines
On new Shimmer, the resin that's right.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
Sticky puddles of red on the ground,
Dripping body parts tossed in a mound,
Brave young men fighting bloodily,
Boots thudding muddily:
War isn't fooling around.

limerick_list.author: Bit
limerick_list.text:
Most females have only one womb;
If didelphic, they've double the room.
Some marsupials form
Two whole wombs.  It's the norm.
But in humans, birth problems might loom.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Each Alcyonacea coral,
Whose polyps are soft and not floral,
Lives in tropical seas.
(Think Phuket or Belize—
Warmer climes than near Scotland's Balmoral.)

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Throw the coverall over my clothes,
And be sure that it doesn't expose
My new slacks to the dust
As we labor. It must
Save my hose, so it goes to my toes.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
From the shambles of London came bone,
While from Cornwall came feldspar-rich stone.
Mixed with clay, they're bone china —
No porcelain's finer.
Stoke-on-Trent is the source of my own.

limerick_list.author: Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
An armature furnishes shape,
And upon it a sculptor will drape
Maybe wax, maybe clay,
In adroit overlay
Till his art leaves its viewers agape.

limerick_list.author: Dottie
limerick_list.text:
As they swam, said the tiddler to Dad,
"Here's a friend!"  "No, he's not, that one's bad!
Though his smile is inviting,
Those teeth will be biting;
That's a dentex—swim fast, little lad!"

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The ballerina in full arabesque
Was a sight nothing short of grotesque.
All her closest friends say,
"You've no place in ballet,
But you might do quite well in burlesque!"

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Said a bloke who was sad and would mope,
"Broke my microscope, Joe; I can't cope."
"There's no lens left in mine,
But Mike Ross's is fine,"
I replied, "Try the Zeiss Mike Ross scope!"

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Antiurban fanatics don't like
To reside where you can't ride a bike
Without soon getting brushed
By a taxi, or rushed
Like a steer in a herd down the pike.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
An elogist finds the apt phrase
In a song or a poem of praise
That he loudly proclaims—
A pronouncement that aims
To amaze and set passions ablaze.

limerick_list.author: DBRHoffman
limerick_list.text:
Fabricius' (he of the bursa)
Anatomical studies diverse-a
On the organs of birds
Left us one of those words
That we're stuck with, for better or worse-a.

limerick_list.author: GaZoom
limerick_list.text:
When the doldrums cause versing to dwindle,
Flames of passion I hope to enkindle.
Will my muse light my fire?
Will it brightly inspire?
Well, maybe this olive I've ginned'll.

limerick_list.author: EdRush
limerick_list.text:
When the botany prof up and bawled,
"Well, a natural outgrowth is called
An enation, you dolt!",
Well, sir, that was a jolt!
To be yelled at like that? I'm appalled!

limerick_list.author: Recumbentman
limerick_list.text:
A flatworm's a worm that is flat.
There's little to say beyond that.
Acelom's a feature.
The pestilent creature
Can get in your gut and sit pat.

limerick_list.author: Bill LaVern Kalles
limerick_list.text:
With Nirvana the lyrics weren't fun.
Kurt Cobain was tormented, undone.
Adding more drugs and strife,
Courtney Love was his wife
Till the end, when he used his own gun.

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
For the terrible taste that it brings,
This is one of my least favored things.
Sip its water and savor
The irony flavor?
Beware the chalybeate springs!

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
In his charley-ken (watch-box), the sentry
Is alert to each exit and entry,
The comings and goings
And to-ings and fro-ings
Alike, of both peasants and gentry.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Would Dawn, with her fingers of pink,
Partickerly care what I think?
Just in case, I should try,
"What a beeee-eautiful sky!"
So her light doesn't go on the blink.

limerick_list.author: Andrew Burnet
limerick_list.text:
She wasn't outstandingly pretty;
Neither elegant, charming nor witty,
But her bristols (oh my)
Didn't half catch the eye!
Did she score? Every player at City!

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
To the waitress I yelled in frustration,
"BLTs are, for your information,
Bacon sandwiches, not
What you brought me!"  I got
Theologians of Black Liberation.

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
Is this substance here acid or base?
A pH test determines its place.
I would pay lots of money
For tests for what's pHunny,
So a joke won't pHall pHlat on its pHace.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
Pads on rotors make braking a breeze
When the calipers give them a squeeze.
Hydraulic's the link
(Kicks in quick as a wink) —
Brings your car to a stop with great ease.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
One 'customer' pinches a snack.
Another hides sweets in her mac.
These shoplifters (thieves)
Will slip goods up their sleeves,
But we'll sue them: it's counter-attack.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A date palm's a tree that awaits
With the wonderful fruit it creates.
It is often the basis
Of a welcome oasis—
A fabulous hangout for dates.

limerick_list.author: Lee Raven
limerick_list.text:
Many tales are farfetched, we agree.
See our hero, the handsome marquis,
With his magical sword,
Gain the Dragon Lord's hoard —
Epic action and home before tea.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The disciples were Christ's chosen few.
To discover their history, you
In the Gospels may delve.
You'll opine there were twelve—
Or read Luke and decide: eighty-two!

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Young Echo's in love with Narcissus,
And dreams she'll one day be his missus.
But the youth has his eyes
On a handsomer prize.
"My reflection," he sighs, "is what bliss is."

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
No refrigerant?  That's a disgrace!
 For this play, we need fog.  Go and chase
 Down some packets, a few:
Solid-form CO2
Or there'll be no dry ice in the place.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
He's a chorist (he sings in the choir)
With a voice many people admire.
Boy soprano at seven
With a voice straight from heaven,
As a basso at last he'll retire.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
He was Deputy Secretary of State
Under Bush — Richard Armitage.  Wait!
That's who outed Ms. Plame.
Most have not heard his name,
'Cause it's Rove the press told us to hate.

limerick_list.author: timon
limerick_list.text:
In my laptop, they say, there's a data bus,
Which conveys all my data. I'd rate a 'bus'
As something quite slow:
Where'd my search result go?
Perhaps it is catching a later bus?

limerick_list.author: David and Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"Let's draw lots," Hadya teased. "I feel bad!
Draw the 'HAD' (not a 'had') — you'll be glad!"
Cheating Had also drew,
So the six poor guys who
Had had "had", Had had had (Had had "HAD").

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
A silly aversion (absurd!)
Is irrational fear of a word.
Logophobia strikes
Our adults and our tykes.
There are people, I've heard, who hate turd.

limerick_list.author: timon
limerick_list.text:
It's a place where a bastion wall
Makes an angle; it's what experts call
By a name anatomical:
A 'shoulder' (how comical),
But dressed up in French as epaule.

limerick_list.author: Bluebelle
limerick_list.text:
This corona's a virus so mean
That it enters lungs' linings unseen,
Where it hugely expands,
While we all wash our hands,
As we battle with COVID-19.

limerick_list.author: Michael Toalster
limerick_list.text:
Aoristically speaking, he did;
What then happened, however, stays hid.
Did he finish somehow?
Does he still do it now?
Looks like Greek to you? Surely, you kid.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Going balls to the wall, Raymond Massey
Hit the highway.  First stop: Tallahassee.
Two days later: Nevada.
(This expression has nada
To do with that gentleman's chassis.)

limerick_list.author: alan meyer
limerick_list.text:
The sous-chef complied with your wish.
He's succeeded in cooking this dish.
He found salmon and shad
(Smelt were not to be had).
Here! Gemisch of anadromous fish!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
The finest apparel's my passion,
But orange is never in fashion.
And a jumpsuit? No way!
Even after that day
When my chips I shall finally cash in.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
My Chemistry grade's a disgrace.
The compound they gave me to trace
As my final exam
Was an ampholyte; damn!
I just couldn't tell: acid or base?

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Brontosaurus, Seanconnery, Tea,
Bonk, Millosevich—what can these be?
Bobhope, Pecker, Daveclark—
Are you still in the dark?
So are they. Click this link and you'll see.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
If you work where the water's all wavy,
Like the merchant marine or the Navy,
Should the cat leave you striped
With no blood to be wiped,
Seamen call it a goose without gravy.

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
Antismoking? You bet. Yes, it's true.
It's disgusting and rude, in my view.
But I'm not some dumb wacko
Who's antitobacco.
I don't mind the kind you can chew.

limerick_list.author: Richard Stehr
limerick_list.text:
For this ego that I have been dealt,
Please don't gift me with necktie or belt.
But a new derby hat
Would be great; give me that,
'Cause I crave that my presents be felt.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
'68, with the protesters, fuzz.
'69, on the moon — Neil and Buzz.
In the CBS fort
Was the Cronkite report.
And that is the way that it was.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
I know I will sound like a dork.
But a gluon, to me's, like a cork.
To free quarks, what I do
Is use quarkscrews (do you?),
Then apply fifty foot-pounds of torque.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
A limerick starts out with rhyme A,
And the next line must end the same way.
But the next two you see
Beget new end-rhyme B,
And the punch line has A again — yay!

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Use the flatboats tied up alongshore.
They will flat your goods fresh from your store.
Slow but sure, they'll deliver
To merchants downriver.
The damn railroads will charge you far more.

limerick_list.author: skipjordan and R. A. Shortfellow
limerick_list.text:
While commuting, my spirits will sag —
The long drive-time to work is a drag.
By the end of the trip,
My poor brain's lost its grip,
Concentration has started to flag.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
In the forum we're chewing the fat;
Pros and cons we discuss as we chat.
All we members will share
Our opinions; we care
About what will ensue after that.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Buccaneers once jerked meat on a grill
Made of wood (a boucan). They might still
Be the barbecue kings,
But they liked gold and rings
And turned pirate for more of a thrill.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
It's an entry-level desktop design.
Never used one? No sweat, you'll be fine.
Plug it in, you're connected,
And virus-protected.
As a start-up, it's top of the line.

limerick_list.author: OldFitzer
limerick_list.text:
Once a dealer of stocks, now I'm broke.
My wife left for some card-dealer bloke.
Worse, the car dealer man
Repossessed my new van —
Where's my dealer, I need me a toke.

limerick_list.author: FlippingMackerel
limerick_list.text:
They watched me with mild disbelief
As my summary lagged, to their grief
(I was using their time).
So they griped, "It's a crime—
We'd like a brief briefer, you thief!"

limerick_list.author: art bates
limerick_list.text:
How can someone advise a young lad
On the wonders of women? Egad!
There's a great deal to know,
And so much you can't show,
And he seldom can ask Mom or Dad.

limerick_list.author: Mary
SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"What are dragbars?  Some gin mills with scenes
That appeal to transvestite marines?"
"No; my tractors, for real,
Have these bars made of steel
That attach to my reaping machines."

limerick_list.author: Doug Aldridge
limerick_list.text:
The small, quiet town was quite clannish;
Their life was too good to let vanish.
To keep it that way,
They voted last May:
"Non-natives we totally banish!"

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Mommy's nearsighted—lifelong myopia—
While Daddy sees double (diplopia).
But I can't explain why,
With that history, I
Turned out walleyed. I've got exotropia.

limerick_list.author: Scott Campisi
limerick_list.text:
Stocks are up and the market is flyin'.
Gotta cover—there ain't no denyin':
We were short; we were wrong.
Guess we shoulda been long
'Cause the bulls are in town, and they're buyin'.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Unannounced, in their usual way,
Thoughts of death interrupted my day.
I know everyone dies,
But it seems my demise
Comes to mind more and more as I gray.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
If you want to describe the bacteria
That you found on your trip to Siberia,
For acidophil germs,
Stain with acid confirms
They are anthrax—or maybe diphtheria.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Cher, this racket in ditch and in pond
Ain't "Aiee!" or that old "Jolie Blonde",
But a great Cajun chorus
Of frogs. They ignore us —
They're shouting for gals to respond.

limerick_list.author: stella
Bit
limerick_list.text:
You have lumps on your neck and your head;
They're so painful, you wish you were dead.
This infection exotic
(Actinomycotic)
Is from actinomyces that spread.

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
"Embonpoint means a fullness of figure,"
I remarked to my love. "Am I bigger?"
She shot back, with a glare.
"Bigger? You? Au contraire!"
(I'm aware of her scary hair trigger).

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Those earworms?  They drive me insane.
Getting rid of them's hard.  They remain
Far too long.  I don't like
That they won't take a hike.
I get stuck with those hooks in my brain.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The blow to Joe's gut was traumatic
To his liver; its function's erratic.
It seems to be leaking,
And technically speaking
The fluid is extrahepatic.

limerick_list.author: John Critten
limerick_list.text:
Like a fool, into things he will rush.
I'm not going to beat 'round the bush:
Working on the assumption
This guy's got no gumption,
I'd say he's as daft as a brush.

limerick_list.author: Seth Brown
limerick_list.text:
A-b-l., if it's in lowercase,
Can refer to the ablative case.
 But the acronym, well,
 In all caps ABL
Can have meanings all over the place.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
In the tropics amphibians race,
But one family's setting the pace.
Those ignoring their wishes
Will sleep with the fishes.
Caecilians are running the place.

limerick_list.author: TrossL
limerick_list.text:
A monk who is Turkish or Persian,
Who's embraced "pauper lifestyle immersion",
Should not make you nervous.
What he's called is a Dervis,
Or Dervise (an alternate version).

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
A criterion's used to compare,
Though if more than one standard is there
You've criteria, but,
For a bicycling nut,
A criterium's racing with flair.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
Chlorprothixene: among the first-born
First-gen antipsychotics.  We warn:
Weight gain, sweats, heart rate high,
Constipation, mouth dry,
And great lethargy. (So, a false dawn?)

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Blowing cool, and quite strong, the wind's fresh.
I've got goose pimples — see? — on bare flesh!
I must put on a cardie;
I'm not very hardy.
In Lancashire folks call me nesh.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I'm a day student; Morty's a boarder.
The dorm captain acts as his warder.
I go home every night
And get high as a kite,
While the boarding school keeps him in order.

limerick_list.author: Edmund Conti
limerick_list.text:
The Achaeans convened some Greek cities—
Formed a league to resolve nitty-gritties.
This was back in BC
But the Romans said, "Gee,
Time to end this.  Too many committees."

limerick_list.author: Jacqui Brown
limerick_list.text:
In her dressing gown, Cindy will wait,
Watching minutes crawl by till her date.
"Won't you hand me my dress?
Does my hair look a mess?"
But, alas, her Prince Charming is late.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Near my hospital room in a line
Are my bingo pals, hoping I'm fine.
Now the doc's at the door
(I'm in N-34),
And he's calling my tumor . . . B-9!

limerick_list.author: David Franks
limerick_list.text:
When one uses a beer bong, seems one'll
Drink a whole lot of beer through a funnel
That's attached to a tube.
O thou frat boy, O rube,
See the light at the end of the tunnel?

limerick_list.author: Kevin
limerick_list.text:
When watching a live armadillo
In the plains, by the trunk of a willow,
Its resemblance, I'm frank,
Is more to a tank
Than something that's soft like a pillow.

limerick_list.author: Basingstoke
limerick_list.text:
Of autapomorphic I speak:
Of characteristics unique
To the DNA soup
Of a similar group
Called a taxon (biology's clique).

limerick_list.author: art bates
limerick_list.text:
The elephant, big as a house,
Is afraid of the tiniest mouse.
And the mouse fears a cat—
There is some sense in that—
But then, man fears a wee bitty louse.

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
Your approval's applause, and my day
Gets brightened; the memory of nay-
Saying's banished. A twitch
Of a smile throws a switch
That tells me I'm doing OK!

limerick_list.author: FlippingMackerel
limerick_list.text:
To a drunk passerby I ascribed
The epithet "Man Who Imbibed".
Did his fists disagree?
Well, I can't pronounce "V" —
But heck! I'm just glad I surbibed!

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
Condensation of moisture from air
Can be seen as small droplets where there
Are cool faces below
What as "dew point" we know;
A component and heat transfer pair.

limerick_list.author: J. E. Pettit
art bates
limerick_list.text:
A lone bag on the carousel rode
And I wondered just what was its load:
Was it missed or mislaid,
Or just baggage that strayed—
Or a suitcase about to explode?

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
There are banners and babies to kiss
And a bandstand where nothing's amiss.
The machinery hums
When the candidate comes.
The advance man has seen to all this.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
Early work in genetic mutations
Studied factors that forced aberrations.
Coined from root words Hellenic,
The word diplogenic
Voiced duality in these creations.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Aboriginal Aussies got slurred
In a song by Rolf Harris.  What's heard?
Let me Abos go loose.
He ditched later the use
Of that hurtful, disparaging word.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
I've heard Bullfighter now is the name
Of some software increasing in fame
For the way it attacks
And gives jargon the ax.
"Obfuscation no more!" is its claim.

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
I replace names of things I forget
With a "fit-them-all", as when I met
This cute chick. Took the lead.
Arm outstretched. Asked if she'd
Hold my doodah, a ploy I regret.

limerick_list.author: DenmarK
limerick_list.text:
Sean O'Farrell exclaimed with alarm, "A fight?
With a ballot box, boys, and a Carmelite!"
"You fools! It's a gun
That you need, not a nun!"
Whispered Seamus. "He said: bring your Armalite."

limerick_list.author: Jim Vincent
limerick_list.text:
My sense of frustration, alas,
Comes to pass when he fails to show class:
Hanging carrots up front
Is my owner's cheap stunt.
And to think he thinks I am the ass!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
My bedroom set (oak) wuz too plain,
So's I hired dis Danish guy, Blaine,
To go tinge it all red.
"Yer a moron," he said.
He distained it, dis Dane, wid disdain.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
On technology, tubes, and retorts,
And in geeky domains of all sorts,
I can chatter with ease—
I'm conversant with these—
But my God, do not quiz me on sports!

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Look for me in the roof-rescue scenes,
Not in flannels or sweatshirt and jeans.
No, I'll dress for the floods
In my sexiest duds.
Chopper shot? I'll look hot on your screens.

limerick_list.author: Steve Ngai
limerick_list.text:
An axial view of your head
Can be had from the tip of your bed
Or by medical scan;
In the latter you can
See a big fluid X, it is said.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
A playwright with name recognition
Was wooed with a broad proposition.
"We'd like something new
For our theater to do,
And we'll pay you a handsome commission."

limerick_list.author: Bill Cernansky
limerick_list.text:
The horseracing gates are not set,
But as always, I'm placing my bet.
I don't care where they start;
It's an ante-post art
(Never mind that I haven't won yet).

limerick_list.author: Giorgio Coniglio
limerick_list.text:
Our French brethren confirm using oui;
It means ''Yes! In response, we agree".
To your statement or query,
Like "Are you nice, dearie?"
They say "Es-tu gentil?" ... "Oui, chérie."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
This herb is described as, well, "weedy,"
Not distinguished at all—low and seedy.
So when chaffweed was found
'Round my lawn to abound,
I cried: "Ground cover, please! Yes, indeedy."

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
Can you take a respectful critique?
Your behavior is all tongue in cheek;
You're so sly, you're facetious,
Sarcastic and specious,
Capricious and flip, so to speak.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
The bank can't detect what they're owed!
They report that their mail's overflowed!
The software's a mess;
We are under duress.
Find the problem and fix the darn code!

limerick_list.author: Chaiwallah
limerick_list.text:
My neighbour's an excellent cook;
Likes his carp charcoal-grilled "off the hook."
So nine platinum blondes
(In a line past his ponds)
Made a barbecue down by the brook.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Adyghe is what's spoken by maids
Out in Georgia.  Long garlands and braids
Are the custom as they,
"Gussied up," as they say,
Go to cheer Adyghe pride parades.

limerick_list.author: J. E. Pettit
limerick_list.text:
Folks are oddly, profoundly obsessed
With the bountiful size of my chest.
I'm not selfish; I share,
So I titillate, bare.
If you're eager to stare, be my guest.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
Please give me the strength to conceive
That, with treatment, this cancer will leave
Me alone with my life
And my kids and my wife
And result in a lengthy reprieve.

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
Do you want to recolour your cat?
Get a tub or a trough or a vat.
In this back place your dye.
Add your cat, rinse and dry—
If she dies, then she'll make a fine hat.

limerick_list.author: bearybp
limerick_list.text:
It's cholesterol-free, low in fat,
And I don't have a problem with that.
As tomato puree
I suppose it's okay,
But this catsup tastes nothing like cat.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Work performed by an ill-trained domestic
Brings to mind a word long and majestic.
The term floccipend too
("Judge as worthless") will do
Since the other is not anapestic.

limerick_list.author: GalFisk
limerick_list.text:
A grid fin's a lattice of wings,
Resembling a grid (of all things).
It can easily fold
And keeps rockets controlled,
As it good steerability brings.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
When I sculpted a bust Belle adored,
A French dip was my tasty reward.
That's a sandwich of meat
On a bun, white or wheat,
On which seasoned pan juices are poured.

limerick_list.author: waterrocks
limerick_list.text:
Then music is heard — how alarming!
But Caliban's calm, since it's charming.
The isle, he declares,
Full of sounds and sweet airs,
Isn't harmful, though sometimes disarming.

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
There's this novel I'm trying to write
But the deadline looks awfully tight
And the word count's too low—
How to boost it? I know!
Add more adverbs and adjectives. Quite!

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
"Don't eat while you swim" is our rule.
We came up with it after a fool
Turned his caviar paste
Into waterborne waste:
You may not take a dip in the pool.

limerick_list.author: J. E. Pettit
limerick_list.text:
There's a prominent welt on my skin
Where a chigoe has burrowed within.
She's a tropical flea
That's too little to see—
And she's laying her eggs in my chin!

limerick_list.author: neilski
limerick_list.text:
Though it looks like brown sugar's refined
Somewhat less than the common white kind,
There is no taste that's fairer
Than sweet Demerara.
Is that song by the Stones on your mind?

limerick_list.author: proof
SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"For your cataracts, this plant's a killer!
Don't grind it to put in a pill," her
Mom tells her. "Its juice
Is the part put to use:
Just a drop from a fresh dusty miller."

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
The European pond turtle: a fellow,
Shell brown, hint of green, spotted yellow,
Who's semi-aquatic,
Moves slowly (not static),
And lives a life gentle and mellow.

limerick_list.author: Paperdragon
limerick_list.text:
In the dark, in a beautiful box
With no lid and no hinges or locks,
It remains safe and sound,
Golden-yellow and round.
(You need fertilised ones to make flocks.)

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I live on Long Island—right here.
There's a town that's called Commack quite near,
And my postal address
Should be Commack, I guess—
Where's its commark (its ancient frontier)?

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
I apologise: yes, it's a mess.
It's a foul up, I have to confess.
I thought I could bake
A big marble cake:
Shouldn't microwave metal, I guess!

limerick_list.author: Jacqui Brown and DenmarK
limerick_list.text:
Most fearsome of all of the flails
Is the cat — that's the cat o' nine tails.
The tar began stripping,
Just dreading his whipping.
It took the wind out of his sails.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
"Take to leader," the little green man
From the spaceship abruptly began.
From Mars he had sprung,
And he did speak our tongue ...
In the grammarless way of his clan.

limerick_list.author: Thomas Taylor
limerick_list.text:
Whether 'freemen', or troops of the Czar,
The horse-faring Cossacks ranged far;
From the west Asian lowland
They even reached Poland
(Though these days it's quicker by car).

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
I had downloaded Baby Makes Three,
Although chargeably so, I now see.
My last credit card bill
Was a hard-to-take pill.
I thought stuff on the Net was for free!

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
Pumped oxygen ion transition
Explains a perplexing condition:
The bright iridescence
Of Bowen fluorescence
In nebulae known for emission.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin and Graham Lester
limerick_list.text:
The women are blonde there and thinnish.
Shout "akka"?  You'll only diminish
Your chance to get kinky
With gals in Helsinki,
And whatever you start, you won't Finnish.

limerick_list.author: Mad Kane
limerick_list.text:
There once was an agent, quite tough,
Who cut all his deals in the buff.
When his clients asked why,
He would give this reply:
"When I'm nude, no one dares give me guff."

limerick_list.author: sallycello
limerick_list.text:
He was hoping his stay would be briefer;
He's in jail just for smoking a reefer.
But he gets so laid back,
Spends his time in the sack,
So what does he need to be free fer?

limerick_list.author: Ulfras
limerick_list.text:
That doctor put drops in my eyes,
Made my pupils both double in size.
See, atropine's made
From the deadly nightshade...
But I hope it won't cause my demise.

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
Our bodies are pressed close together;
Heavy cloth and a thin coat of leather
Keep us slightly apart
As our work day we start
With commuting in cold, wintry weather.

limerick_list.author: Errol Nimbly
limerick_list.text:
In July and in August we laze
In the shade while the sun is ablaze.
Or we lie on the beach,
Take a swim, eat a peach...
These, the dog days of summer, I praise.

limerick_list.author: Carol June Hooker
limerick_list.text:
Since asbestos can give people cancer,
Find Pink Panther:  it might be the answer
To keep a house warm.
Glass in fiber-like form,
An asbestoid R-factor enhancer.

limerick_list.author: alan meyer
limerick_list.text:
When Trump, the Commander-in-Chief, he
Couldn't sleep and pursued some relief, he
Inscrutably tweeted
A word?  Uncompleted?
The absurd so-called word was covfefe.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
In each facial canal in my head,
There's no shipping; a nerve's there instead
(In each temporal bone
As a doc would have known).
Now, please leave them alone… till I'm dead.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A proton was learning about
Antiprotons and wondered, in doubt,
Just what would ensue
If they mated, these two—
Each would cancel the other one out.

limerick_list.author: Morphiend
limerick_list.text:
If you think that society's rules
Just exist for society's fools,
Then you're likely amoral,
And might think, though I'd quarrel,
That you're one of society's jewels.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Well behind your protuberant gut
These two prominent hemispheres jut.
When your rear's super-size,
Are you prone to crack wise?
No, your comments are anything but.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Some males who are alpha appear
To lead by derision and fear.
There's Ashcroft and Donald,
And Dubya and Ahnold.
We girlie men bring up the rear.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
"So is that what you call a disease
That's presenting with symptoms like these?"
Asked the patient in shock
Of her dubious doc,
For whom acrisy led to unease.

limerick_list.author: Carol June Hooker
limerick_list.text:
Ethiopian highlands enclose
Stands of Africa's only wild rose;
Called Rosa abyssinica,
Its fragrance edenic, a
Shrub seven metres tall grows.

limerick_list.author: WordWeaver
limerick_list.text:
Joe Heller says "Catch-22"
Is a logical snare in which you
Will be damned if you don't,
If you do, will, or won't…
So just do what They tell you to do.

limerick_list.author: Errol Nimbly
limerick_list.text:
The captain's just freed all our slaves —
Withered thralls, chained to oars to fight waves.
Don't know why they were miffed
When we cast them adrift —
Disinthrallment is what a slave craves.

limerick_list.author: Carol June Hooker
limerick_list.text:
Acanthi are famed, for a leaf
That's a classical sculpture motif.
These mauve and white bloomers
(According to rumors)
Look great as a teddy bear brief.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Kunta Kinte, it can't be disputed,
For slave life was wholly unsuited.
He was barely a man
When his troubles began:
From his home he was cruelly disrooted.

limerick_list.author: Kalleh and Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
She loves academe and agrees
That having a lot of degrees
Is crucial for her;
Her teachers concur,
But sadly, they lack expertise.

limerick_list.author: Bill LaVern Kalles
limerick_list.text:
When faced with the vertical smile,
Some choose to ignore it, but I'll
Take a whole 'nother tack.
I'll make some nasty crack:
"When did 'plumber chic' come back in style?"

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Keep your pumpkin, I love French silk pie!
Its rich chocolate flavor is why.
Made with real cream you whip,
And the eggs you can skip.
Have a slice—kiss your diet goodbye!

limerick_list.author: David Franks
limerick_list.text:
His dislike for his cellmate was hearty.
What to do? Nothing subtle or arty:
He jumped him and wrapped him
In bedding, then sapped him—
He threw him a nice blanket party.

limerick_list.author: Recumbentman
limerick_list.text:
A gittern's an early guitar.
Surprising, how many there are:
Quitarra, ghiterna—
It's easy to learn; a
Few chords would have taken you far.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
An atomy's tiny, a mite.
An iota that's quite out of sight.
It's a minuscule jot,
Microcosmic. A dot.
A diminutive bit of all right.

limerick_list.author: Bill Cernansky
limerick_list.text:
Disobedience, when it is civil,
Is refusal to kowtow to drivel
The government says
(Like, "We're banning all PEZ").
We'll protest until attitudes swivel.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
There's a fellow I see every day,
As he sits in his window (a bay),
And he stares at the sky.
I at times wonder why—
I assume he has nothing to say.

limerick_list.author: turnip
limerick_list.text:
Last week, I found work as a barback,
Hauling beer and supplies from so far back
In the storeroom that day
That I heard the valet
Say, "I'm so never giving this car back."

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Once a bit twiddler, using its "wits",
Finds its bits where the bit pattern sits,
Bitwise shifting, or changing,
Or bit rearranging
Are routine for routines twiddling bits.

limerick_list.author: EdRush
limerick_list.text:
Pliny's Romans knew one copper piece
As an as, but a little increase
Of one's fortune to ten
And those asses were then
A decussis, so hunger could cease.

limerick_list.author: Nitelaf
limerick_list.text:
At the fair, the old snaggletoothed carny
Made a statement I thought to be blarney:
"Now, ladies and gents,
In the first of our tents
We've the huge purple dinosaur, Barney!"

limerick_list.author: SusanL
limerick_list.text:
Mogul skiers (this breed once was rare)
With their hot-dogging, devil-may-care
Way of living out loud
Are so cocky and proud—
Bold as brass when they're catching some air.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
What can and what cannot be bought
Is a lesson no school ever taught.
Little kids eye up sweets,
Salivating for treats,
Then they look and discover they're short.

limerick_list.author: otherwisefine
limerick_list.text:
Mikhail, if you see Uncle Vanya,
Or Olga, Natasha, or Tanya,
Just tell them the scheme
Is to sit in the steam
In our sauna-type bath called a banya.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Every week, on my Sunday excursion,
I try to surprise the old Persian.
My approaches are deft:
I sneak up from stage left,
Then he turns to the right—dextroversion.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Jean-Jacques' death was a terrible blow.
He left all of his mistresses dough.
They debated all night—
How to bury him right—
As they wanted the rite comme il faut.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
To the left and the right of the sign
Known as equals expressions align
(That is if your math talents
Can make the two balance).
Equations — no talent of mine.

limerick_list.author: Kalleh
limerick_list.text:
There's a difference 'tween "though" and "although,"
Although it is subtle, I know.
Use "though" when in doubt;
The linguists won't shout.
Tho spell it like this?  I say "NO!"

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Dan McGee shouldn't drink eau de vie.
Brandy's trouble; the neighbors agree.
Drinking "water of life"
Brings on strife with his wife.
First he's ranting, then singing off key.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
A coupée is a movement in dance
Where your legs must be bent to advance.
It was done in the halls
Of Versailles at the balls
Held by Louis Quatorze, king of France.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
1 GJ is one billion joules,
Or a gigajoule. Fossil-based fuels
Provide GJs aplenty:
Three barrels, 'round 20.
Don't waste all that energy, fools.

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
The student Prince William, ere regent,
In first year, while only a wee gent
And recently fledged,
His beak yellow-edged
(A bec jaune / béjaune), was a bejant.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Said the Herald, "They funeralized Dave."
Proper English use? Dave was its slave.
If he somehow can get
Local papers, I bet
He'll rotationalize in his grave.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Your degree made you quickly employable
In a job you find highly enjoyable.
Your good name keeps you there—
Avoid slander; beware:
Reputations are wholly destroyable.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
This spring day is so gradely, so fine,
All life's wondrousness seems to align.
And this Magic, I know,
Fills me up head to toe
So I'll thrive, not lie supine and whine.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
As a batter, our left fielder Shawn
Has an excellent eye and great brawn.
The last homer he crushed?
The announcer had gushed:
"That one's outa here! That ball is gone!"

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
That dynamo hotshot we hired
Grew fatigable—easily tired.
What weird weed was he taking,
Or was he just faking?
No matter—last night he expired.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
We're surprised by some renegade Sioux:
Are there injured? Surprisingly few.
We've lost horses; that's fair,
'Cause they've left us our hair
And gained honor by just counting coup.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
Please be sure not to stuff up your lines
When you meet our great star, one who shines
On the screen. To be safe,
Do not say, "G'day, Ralph",
But more formally, thus: "Mr Fiennes".

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
We invited the stranger to dine.
His manners and clothing were fine,
But he turned out a wastrel.
He picked up his costrel
By its twine, and he guzzled the wine.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
If America's envoy proclaims
That he's gone to the "Court of St. James"
To present his credentials,
He's missed the essentials
Of accurate usage of names.

limerick_list.author: Doug Harris and Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
I had reckoned I could be "the Bard"
Till my progress was suddenly marred
By Shakespearience lacking.
My fans sent me packing.
At last I've succeeded: I'm barred.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
The gravy train rolls right on through
For as long as I'm married to you.
You're a keeper.  I work
For your dad.  The great perk?
I make scads but I've little to do.

limerick_list.author: Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
"The core of the problem's the apple,"
Mused Adam to Eve. "Let's get Snapple
To juice it and sell it.
If Eden's gone, hell!  It
Beats blaming that serpent in chapel."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Don't put missiles in storage bins, son.
You'll improve now your schooling's begun.
You possess a strong disciplinableness,
So who needs any missilebinableness?
[See? I told you this couldn't be done!]

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
I think geckos are thoroughly neat,
Sticking fast with their densely haired feet.
With no eyelids, they slick
Eye-scales clear with a lick.
And they chirp (got no phones, so can't tweet).

limerick_list.author: J. E. Pettit
limerick_list.text:
When you're chasing the dragon, it's true
You can die from the high you pursue.
Fight its fiery breath,
For the dragon is death.
Slay it first, or the dragon slays you.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
King Francis of France said, "Sail west.
Find a route to the East; that's your quest.
Jacques Cartier, bring me treasure;
Claim lands beyond measure.
Our New World adventure be blessed."

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Alabama is facing a mess.
The Magnolia State's under duress.
Were teenagers harassed?
Is Trump not embarrassed?
Dems all hope they conclude Moore is less.

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
The deduplication of data,
Though it saves you much space, will create a
Hidden problem as well.
With space gone, I hear tell,
It's much harder to claw it back later.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
The Three Stooges would squabble and squall;
"Spread out!" bellowed Moe, you'll recall.
But perhaps if he'd said,
"Would you please both despread?"
We'd have laughed at them — well, not at all.

limerick_list.author: Gravely
limerick_list.text:
Treat your calf like your son or your daughter.
Give it peaches and cream, not just water. 
Ere its flesh starts to bloat
Put a knife to its throat,
'Cause your fatling is ready for slaughter.

limerick_list.author: S. M. Hanlon
limerick_list.text:
That man's careless for all that he's smart,
Unreliable right from the start.
Yes, he's feckless at best,
As his friends will attest,
Though a nice enough fellow at heart.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Cardiopathy's playing a part
In his troubles, and so is a tart.
His cholesterol's high;
Now this hooker says bye,
And he loves her. It's breaking his heart.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
All your answers are terse and laconic.
You seem down, Dan, my friend, and it's chronic.
Come with me and I'll serve a
Fine herb—contrayerva.
It's known as a natural tonic.

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
Why's that sign keep a-blinkin'  at me?
That one, just up ahead?  Oh, I see—
It is tellin' me, "Halt!"
No—it's just Uncle Walt
Advertisin'  his "Specials 4T."

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Penelope's raking in dosh:
"For carved couples of carrots and squash —
Tasty intertwined nudity
(Crudités crudity),
Served in the raw — Naked Nosh."

limerick_list.author: Workshop
limerick_list.text:
Female endings? A suffix like -ess
Can be clearly employed to express
That a steward's name "Van"
Means a woman, no man:
Vanessa, the trim stewardess.

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
Chinese white is a pigment that's bright,
For it's made from zinc oxide and quite
A good color for clouds
In the blue—or for shrouds,
If you're painting a ghost in the night.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
When he's late with his child support checks,
Mack gets serious grief from his ex.
His response "I need dough
For my bookie, y'know,"
Is a cop-out she roundly rejects.

limerick_list.author: John Critten
limerick_list.text:
Our captain's elected to field,
So our fate, I expect, he has sealed.
This pitch will take spin.
In the fourth we'll be in,
With our weakness on "turners" revealed.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Find these ferns in a tropical area.
They were once used for treating malaria.
When a patient bemoans
His non-healing sick bones,
Chinese doctors may still give Drynaria.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
I love to kill folks, not bloodthirstily —
In a way incontestibly worsetily.
I fill to the brim
The pool where I swim,
Then immerse them, quite slowly, headfirstily.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
"Crooked" Hillary lives. The "deceased"
Bernie Sanders believes he got fleeced.
Though some still feel the Bern,
And for Sanders yet yearn,
They must choose whom they dislike the least.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
For the sake of this joke, let's assume
Jesus Christ, when he dressed in his room,
Put on drawers.  You might find
This amusing: what kind
Did he wear?  Answer: Fruit of Thy Womb.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
When her date made a grab for her garter,
To blind lust he was turned to a martyr.
"She brained him," cops said,
"With a blow to the head."
Disregard how that sounds; he's no smarter.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
If you steal others' music, that sucks!
Pat Boone (clearly one of those schmucks)
In the '50s found fame
Singing "Ain't That a Shame,"
As he wore (and made lots of) white bucks.

limerick_list.author: Kalleh
limerick_list.text:
To aid and abet's to support,
When criminals plan to cavort.
It's surely a crime
Committed by slime,
Though...soon they'll be cases in court.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
We met F2F, AYK.
She's 2G2BT: such a ho!
OMG, what a D8!
Stayed up L8, it was GR8!
CUL8R, BIBI, G2G.

limerick_list.author: Charles Silliman
limerick_list.text:
Calamagrostis, a grass with no peer,
Has a vertical habit held dear.
It's no wonder the famed
PPA went and named
'Karl Foerster' the plant of the year.

limerick_list.author: bob killian
limerick_list.text:
It was clear, in the physics class, that
Little particles rained where I sat.
In those cloud chamber jars?
Cosmic rays, sent from Mars.
That's why I wear a tinfoil hat.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
All I want is a walk in the park;
I've been lugging this chamber of dark
(Your camera obscura)
From Maine to Ventura.
It's time you were making your mark.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The antiapartheid decision
Was enacted to heal the division
Of the blacks from the whites,
To assure equal rights,
And to end other nations' derision.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Though we're far from the center of shock,
The quake's crumbled our whole city block.
We'll need massive assistance
Despite the quake's distance
Epicentral. We're still taking stock.

limerick_list.author: Andrew Burnet
limerick_list.text:
"About-ship, lad!" the captain kept crying.
"Aye, aye skipper!" his mate kept replying.
Till the tar at the tiller
Fell iller and iller—
So seasick he feared he was dying.

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
When my wife took her car for inspection,
It lacked rotors to aid speed-correction
(Pads engage when you tread).
"I need disc brakes," she said.
So I smashed up her record collection.

limerick_list.author: Tristan
limerick_list.text:
Under the moon we embrace,
And promptly begin sucking face;
Almost get to third base,
But the neighbors give chase!
Guess that cul de sac wasn't the place...

limerick_list.author: stella
limerick_list.text:
Though desserts may have doubled her size
And may hasten sweet Cherry's demise,
She declares, "Clafoutis
Are a health food for me!"
But her thighs can't disguise that she lies.

limerick_list.author: Tristan
limerick_list.text:
I once had a co-worker, Wallace,
Who claimed he'd once met Juan Gonzalez.
But he then told my boss
He'd invented mint floss,
So we took his tales cum grano salis.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
For years he has constantly slumbered,
By perceptible thoughts unencumbered.
We're pulling the plug
On this comatose lug,
So the days of his daze are now numbered.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
The tongues were all centum in Kent.
Deep in Europe, the velars were bent,
And this new aberration
Was satemization;
An isogloss marks its extent.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
George Dzundza's an actor whose face
Is one that is easy to place.
On the screen (big or small)
He's remembered by all,
But his name is a tough one to trace.

limerick_list.author: Chavi Beck
limerick_list.text:
In that ode, Schiller's words flowed like water.
"Wax effusive, yes that's what I oughter!
Joy's not born of this world,
But from Heaven unfurled.
I shall call her 'Elysium's daughter.'"

limerick_list.author: timon
limerick_list.text:
An Aussie may comment, "Fair dinkum!"
On a girl, or your house, or your income,
Or a book, or a show,
Or maybe a row
Of glasses of Foster's (then drink 'em).

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
When I say, "Looks like rain," understand
I'm predicting foul weather, offhand.
Should I say, in some chat,
Something's arenoid, that
Could be translated thus: "Looks like sand."

limerick_list.author: creelbm
limerick_list.text:
Spinning round and around at the fair,
Pushed against the steel wall, and my hair
Is spread out in a fan
In this curved metal can.
The centripetal force keeps me there.

limerick_list.author: Jeff Foster
limerick_list.text:
Worried Wes, "This recession ain't funny,
And I frequently fret about money."
But his great-grandma Gertie
Recalled 1930
And told him, "Just deal with it, Sonny."

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Ace high is a hand that can win
When it's poker and no one who's in
Has so much as a pair.
With a queen, do I dare
See his tenner and raise it a fin?

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I've designed several college curricula:
One on bones, like the shoulder's clavicula,
And another, mysterious,
On the secrets of Sirius,
A serious look at Canicula.

limerick_list.author: stella
limerick_list.text:
The ceramist has potted all day,
With love, making art out of clay.
Each mug, plate and bowl
Holds a piece of her soul,
And her heart's in each piece on display.

limerick_list.author: Ritepath
limerick_list.text:
Her pendant lies right on her chest,
Two gemstones more bright than the rest.
Her diatomous pair
Are so perfect, you stare
(At her crystals, that is, not her breast).

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Poor Johnny thought Connie would wan' it:
She'd be donning the bonniest bonnet.
In demurring, she said,
"I'd prefer that my head
Has no bonnet upon it, doggone it!"

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Heard a singer last night at the Met
In a role that I'll never forget.
John Del Carlo's his name;
Singing buffo's his game,
And I haven't stopped laughing as yet.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Arthur Askey rose quickly to fame.
Known as 'big-hearted Arthur', this name
Showed the Brits' admiration
For the comic. Quotation:
"Hello playmates!" his catchphrase became.

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
We're the number-one town in the nation
For low taxes and deregulation,
Which we hope bring to pass
A content middle class
Through the process bourgeoisification.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
In her youth, she researched Dinocerata,
And remains of extinct Eurypterida.
Now she's old and retired,
And this tag she's acquired:
She's Professor of Fossils Emerita.

limerick_list.author: a.groovymind
limerick_list.text:
When her friend from Kiev said, "Let's wed",
She replied, "That's an aisle I won't tread.
Many marriages fail.
Even sex can grow stale."
"Dot's divorce dot could heppen", he said.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
Does this word start with 'I' (as I think) or 'E'?"
The Yank asked the Brit. "That's my inquiry"—
"Either spell it with 'I' or 'E';
Say, though, 'enquiry'
(Not that I'd kick up a stinkery)."

limerick_list.author: ProfKlyve
limerick_list.text:
The term Chermidae now is passé;
It's a taxon that's not used today.
Need to ID a louse
On a plant in your house?
They're in Psyllidae now, where they'll stay.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
You feel choked on account that I smoked?
You got mad? Take a hike! Man, I'm stoked.
Don't you point to the sign!
I'm a stinky old swine?
Well, the smoking ban's hereby revoked!

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Microscopic, the cell organelle
Called endoplasmic reticulum… hell,
I won't say any more
I know I'm a bore —
And you're glad, I am sure, there's the bell!

limerick_list.author: Giri
limerick_list.text:
The truth in whatever Chuck utters
Is quite scanty. Whenever he mutters
Something truly ambiguous
One's quite sure: his exiguous
Love for facts shows because he then stutters.

limerick_list.author: Seth Brown
limerick_list.text:
All my faith in humanity's gutted.
Since my lot and my neighbor's abutted,
 Where they touched I had trod,
 And he sued me. My god,
We're abutting; must he be a butthead?

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
The armor that served as a guard
Would be better to doff and discard.
It's so heavy he lies
Where he fell—and can't rise.
He's been hoist with his own knight's petard.

limerick_list.author: Workshop
limerick_list.text:
Deals founded on faith or on trust
Are fiducial. "We cannot go bust,
'Cause they're trustworthy or
They are honest. What's more,
They're acceptable and they are just."

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
A double entendre's a phrase
That's interpreted two separate ways:
One's innocuous; one
Is quite often a pun —
On risqué innuendo it plays.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Say a plane goes down (falls from the sky)
And a ship goes down somewhere nearby,
Where would I rather be?
That one's easy for me:
I can swim, but I damn sure can't fly.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Among comics, this lady's a pillar;
And of homemaker's lives a distiller.
Her admirers would hang
On the foibles of Fang—
That's the husband of whom? Phyllis Diller.

limerick_list.author: Dr. Work
limerick_list.text:
It's well known why the sky's colored blue,
So that isn't the reason that you
Work on blue-sky research
From your Ivy-League perch:
Curiosity drives what you do.

limerick_list.author: sl8ofhand and stella
limerick_list.text:
Why do curves in a hummingbird's snout
Fit the arc of a blossom's sweet spout?
Is it proof of creation
Or coadaptation
The hummingbird's humming about?

limerick_list.author: jayrusalem
limerick_list.text:
Small blood vessels — many are stored
In your corium, hidden, ignored.
That's essential, but no,
It's not beautiful, so,
Its location's skin-deep, thank the Lord.

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
Mrs. Beeton, whose excellent book
Taught Victorian England to cook,
Would have sooner served nude
Than cook microwaved food.
Dear, I'm begging you, please, take a look!

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
A clever clogs isn't enhancing
His chance of a turn at the dancing
When he shows off his wit;
To a Miss it's no hit,
For a smartass is never entrancing.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
At the desert-based Palace called Caesars
Are showgirls who're famed as crowd pleasers.
You may see them, perhaps,
In the grey, lifeless laps
Of astoundingly wealthy old geezers.

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
You should see what that trendsetting fella writ:
"Try giving up sex for the hell of it."
But the guys that I've kissed
Find me hard to resist.
It's a concept he might have to sell a bit.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
I shall publish this verse and be damned.
So what if you think you are spammed?
It's a poem to share
And I really don't care
If my soul into hellfire is slammed.

limerick_list.author: Workshop
limerick_list.text:
In the boat club next door, we do rowing,
